intro: Stelis valladolidensis, commonly known as the Valladolid orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is an epiphytic plant, typically growing on tree trunks or branches in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white and pink, often arranged in clusters. Its roots are adapted for absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. Stelis valladolidensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in greenhouses or terrariums.
